posts.cooked:
When using voice messages to communicate, the speaker may often have to think for a few seconds, thus creating silence. But this silence has no use for the listener.

It would be useful if Signal offered a way to pause the recording and then continue it. For example, while holding down the mic button, swipe it up to pause, then swipe it back down to continue (similar to swiping it left to cancel).

It could also be a simple pause button, a swiping gesture might not even be necessary. Just having a pause button next to the time counter where one could pause and restart the recording would already be sufficient (and more expressive than another swiping gesture, because it’s clear what this button is for).

i dont think you would need an extra button just pause the recording when letting go of the record button and queue the message before sending, like when you swipe up while recording in other messengers. the just add to the existing message

volse01:

just pause the recording when letting go of the record button

But holding the record button isn’t required – you can swipe up to “lock” in recording mode – so you would need a way to pause in that case.

Herohtar:

But holding the record button isn’t required – you can swipe up to “lock” in recording mode – so you would need a way to pause in that case.

So, the question is, could you implement a pause button like the one that messaging applications like Telegram or Whatsapp have? Personally, I think that this feature would be quite useful. In that sense, I think that in relation to the button to pause the recording of audio Signal is a little behind compared to Whatsapp and Telegram

I’d also opt for a pause button…
What design questions would need to be solved first?
Best,

  • Joachim

Did you start with this @fodinabor

Design

If you do a recording there is the blinking microphone symbol on the left, then the time recording, then a written cancel area. So either put a written pause area left to the cancel area. Or a pause symbol. But I think to get a similar design, a pause word would be good.

Translations

The only question: Is there any language which has a very very long word for pause which then wont fit?

Checking Wiktionary take a temporary rest or break, then Bulgarian, Russian, Finish and especially Indonesian (one long word) seem to have the longest words/phrases.

But checking Wiktionary for halt playback temporarily, then Turkish, German and Hungarian seem to be the longest.

So if the words wont fit, then I’d use the pause symbol, ie unicode U+23F8 which is .

it will be paused not sent, and you’ll be able to hear it before sending.

The recording isn’t paused; it is stopped – that is, you cannot resume recording the same message. What you describe is more like this feature request:

Review voice messages before sending Feature Requests
I heartily second this feature request. Personally, I would never want to send a voice message without listening to it first (or at least having the chance to listen to it). After all, you don’t type text messages blind and send them off without at least having the chance to read them first! @erik55 Considering what you’ve said I’ve made a small mock-up of how this could look like (if this is not the place for mock-ups, please let me know, this is my first post in this forum):

With Text998×139 51.5 KB

With Text After Pause998×139 51.8 KB

(mic would stop blinking when recording is paused)

However, I think it makes sense to combine the pause feature with the “review voice message” feature mentioned by @Herohtar - once you pause the recording you should be able to listen to what you’ve recorded so far (that’s also how most other messengers do it)
For this reason (and also because you avoid issues with different translations) I think using icons would be preferrable. Based on the current design of reviewing a voice message (see commont of @OmarAwjy ), here is my suggestion to combine pausing and reviewing the current recording:

With Icons998×139 53.9 KB

With Icons After Pause998×139 64.5 KB

mic would stop blinking when recording is paused, and can be pressed to continue recording - it would also be an idea to make the mic icon filled when paused, indicating that it can be pressed, but not sure if that makes sense from a UI Design perspective
Yet another idea would be to also use the mic as pause button, so pause and continue recording would be in the same position, but I’m not sure how to properly communicate that the blinking microphone can be used as pause button…
WhatsApp’s most recent execution of recording & previewing voice messages is the best. Signal should take a few notes.
